sen.j: 東福寺駅（とうふくじえき）は、京都府京都市東山区福稲岸ノ上町にある、京阪電気鉄道・西日本旅客鉄道（JR西日本）の鉄道駅。
sen.e: Located in Kishinokami-cho, Fukuine, Higashiyama Ward of Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture, Tofukuji Station is a stop on the Keihan Electric Railway Line and West Japan Railway Company (JR-West) Line.
Located in Kishinokami-cho, Fukuine, Higashiyama Ward of Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture, Tofukuji Station is a stop on the Keihan Electric Railway Line and West Japan Railway Company (JR-West) Line.
Located in Kishinokami-cho, Fukuine, Higashiyama Ward of Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture, Tofukuji Station is a stop on the Keihan Electric Railway and West Japan Railway Company (JR West) lines.

sen.j: 京阪電気鉄道
sen.e: Keihan Electric Railway
Keihan Electric Railway
Keihan Electric Railway

sen.j: 京阪本線
sen.e: Keihan Main Line
Keihan Main Line
Keihan Main Line

West Japan Railway Company (JR-West)
West Japan Railway Company (JR West)

sen.j: 奈良線
sen.e: Nara Line
The Nara Line
Nara Line
sen.cmt: the無しの表現できているため、統一

sen.j: 両線ともICOCA（西日本旅客鉄道）・PiTaPa（スルッとKANSAI協議会）の利用が可能。
sen.e: ICOCA (West Japan Railway Company) and PiTaPa (Surutto Kansai Association) Cards can be used on both lines.
The ICOCA (West Japan Railway Company) and PiTaPa (Surutto Kansai Association) cards can be used on both lines.
The ICOCA (West Japan Railway Company) and PiTaPa (Surutto KANSAI Association) cards can be used on both lines.

sen.j: ただし、JスルーはJR線、スルッとKANSAI対応各種カードは京阪線でのみ使用可能。
sen.e: However, J Through Cards can only be used on JR lines and Kansai Thru Pass compatible Cards only on Keihan Line.
However, J Through cards can only be used on JR lines and Kansai Thru Pass compatible cards can only be used on the Keihan Line.
However, J-Thru cards can only be used on JR lines and KANSAI THRU PASS compatible cards can only be used on the Keihan Line.

sen.j: 相対式2面2線のプラットホームを持つ地上駅となっており、駅舎と改札口は下りホーム（東側）にある。
sen.e: It is an above ground station with two platforms opposite each other and double tracks and the station building and ticket gates are are on the outbound (eastern side) platform.
It is an above-ground station with two platforms opposite each other and double tracks; the station building and ticket gates are on the outbound (east-side) platform.
It is an above-ground station with two platforms opposite each other and double tracks; the station building and ticket gates are on the outbound (east-side) platform.

sen.j: 上りホームにも改札口があり、JRの駅舎および外へ直接出られる通路に通じている。
sen.e: Ticket gates are also installed on the inbound platform and connects to the JR station building and to a passageway for direct exit.
Ticket gates are also installed on the inbound platform; they connect to the JR station building and a passageway for direct exit.
Ticket gates are also installed on the inbound platform; they connect to the JR station building and a passageway for direct exit.

sen.j: なお、互いのホームへは地下道で連絡している。
sen.e: Both platforms are linked by an underpass.
The two platforms are linked by an underpass.
The two platforms are linked by an underpass.

sen.j: のりば
sen.e: Boarding platforms
Boarding platforms
Boarding platforms

sen.j: ※両ホームとも有効長は7両。
sen.e: Both platforms have an effective length to accommodate seven car trains.
Each platform has a length sufficient to accommodate a seven-car train.
※Each platform has a length sufficient to accommodate a seven-car train.

sen.j: 番線表示はない。
sen.e: Track numbers are not indicated.
Track numbers are not indicated.
Track numbers are not indicated.

sen.j: 相対式2面2線のホームを持つ地上駅で、橋上駅を有している。
sen.e: The station's two platforms and double tracks are located above ground opposite each other and the over-track structure houses its administrative offices.
sen.cmt: 駅が地上と橋上に、と二つある表現は不合理故、変えました。
sen.e: The station's two platforms and double tracks are located above ground opposite each other, and the over-track structure houses its administrative offices.
The station's two platforms and double tracks are located above ground opposite each other, and the over-track structure houses its administrative offices.

sen.j: 改札口は1か所のみ。
sen.e: Ticket gates are installed at only one place.
Ticket gates are found in only one location.
Ticket gates are found in only one location.

sen.j: なお駅業務は（株）ジェイアール西日本交通サービスへ委託されている。
sen.e: Station operations are commissioned to West Japan Transportation Service Co., Ltd.
Station operations are commissioned to West Japan Transportation Service Co., Ltd.
Station operations are commissioned to JR West Japan Transportation Service Co., Ltd.

sen.j: 快速系列車停車駅であるが「みどりの窓口」が未だに設置されていない（青春18きっぷの常備券（通称赤券）を取り扱っている）。
sen.e: It is a station at which rapid trains stop, but a JR Ticket Office('Midori-no-madoguchi') has still to be established (Seishun 18 (.popularly known as a Red Ticket) always available.)
It is a station at which rapid trains stop, but a JR Ticket Office ('Midori-no-madoguchi') has yet to be established (Seishun 18, popularly known as a Red Ticket, is always available).
It is a station at which rapid trains stop, but a JR ticket office ('Midori-no-madoguchi') has yet to be established (Seishun 18, popularly known as a Red Ticket, is always available).
sen.cmt: ticket office小文字でJR Westとしました。

sen.j: JRの特定都区市内制度における「京都市内」の駅である。
sen.e: It is station situated within 'Kyoto Municipality' in accordance with JR's Specific Ward Municipal System.
It is station situated within 'Kyoto Municipality' in accordance with JR's Specific Ward Municipal System.
It is station situated within 'Kyoto Municipality' in accordance with JR's Specific Ward Municipal System.

sen.j: のりば
sen.e: Boarding platforms
Boarding platforms
Boarding platforms

sen.j: JR西日本 - 2006年度の1日あたりの利用客数は約6,178人。
sen.e: JR-West - Number of passengers getting on at this station was approximately 6,178 per day in fiscal 2006.
sen.cmt: "約"は"平均"のはずであります。
sen.e: JR-West - The number of passengers getting on at this station was approximately 6,178 per day in fiscal 2006.
JR West - The number of passengers boarding at this station came to approximately 6,178 per day in fiscal year 2006.

sen.j: 京阪電気鉄道 - 2006年度の1日あたりの利用客数は約6,216人。
sen.e: Keihan Electric Railway - Number of passengers getting on at this station was approximately 6,216 per day in fiscal 2006.
sen.cmt: "約"は"平均"のはずであります。
sen.e: Keihan Electric Railway - The number of passengers getting on at this station was approximately 6,216 per day in fiscal 2006.
Keihan Electric Railway - The number of passengers boarding at this station came to approximately 6,216 per day in fiscal year 2006.

sen.j: （いずれも京都府統計書より）
sen.e: (Source: Both Kyoto Prefecture Statistical Report)
(Source: Both from the Kyoto Prefecture Statistical Report)
(Source: Both from the Kyoto Prefecture Statistical Report)

sen.j: 駅名となった東福寺は、秋の紅葉シーズンに観光に訪れる人が多く、駅構内が狭隘なため特に混雑する。
sen.e: Tofukuji, which became the name of the station, is visited by many tourists during the autumn season when trees tint their leaves and station premises become extremely congested due to the limited small space it occupies.

Tofukuji, as the station came to be called, is used by many tourists during the autumn season when the trees change color; the station becomes extremely congested due to the limited space it occupies.

Tofukuji, as the station came to be called, is used by many tourists during the autumn season when the trees change color; the station becomes extremely congested due to the limited space it occupies.

sen.j: 2007年になって、JR西日本などは、京都の東山区地域の渋滞を回避するルートとして、京都駅→東福寺駅→（京阪）七条・五条・四条駅という、乗り換えルートを積極的に勧めている。
sen.e: In 2007, JR-West and other railways positively recommended following the transfer route: Kyoto Station→Tofukuji Station→(Keihan) Shichijo・Gojo・Shijo Stations to avoid the congestion of the Higashiyama district.

In 2007, JR-West and other railways urgently recommended following the transfer route: Kyoto Station→Tofukuji Station→(Keihan) Shichijo・Gojo・Shijo Stations to avoid the congestion of the Higashiyama district.

In 2007, JR West and other railways urgently recommended following the transfer route: Kyoto Station→Tofukuji Station→(Keihan) Shichijo, Gojo, Shijo Stations to avoid the congestion of Kyoto's Higashiyama district.
sen.cmt: ・を、に変更しました。京都の を追加

sen.j: 京都タワーの外壁に広告が掲示されたり（京阪電気鉄道は京都タワーの親会社でもある）、ガイドマップなども作成されているが、当駅が普通（準急）停車駅であるために、依然特急停車駅の七条駅（若しくは近鉄京都線と接続する丹波橋駅）を利用する客が多い。
sen.e: An ad is posted on the exterior wall of Kyoto Tower (Keihan Electric Railway is parent company of the Tower) and guide maps prepared, but as this station is a station at which local (local express) trains stop, many passengers still use Shichijo Station at which limited express trains stop (or Tamba Station which connects to Kintetsu Kyoto Line.)

An ad is posted on the exterior wall of the Kyoto Tower (Keihan Electric Railway is its parent company) and guide maps have been prepared, but since this station is one at which local (local express) trains stop, many passengers still use Shichijo Station at which limited express trains stop (or they use Tamba Station, which connects to the Kintetsu Kyoto Line).

An ad is posted on the exterior wall of the Kyoto Tower (Keihan Electric Railway is its parent company) and guide maps have been prepared, but since this station is a stop for local (sub-express) trains, many passengers still use Shichijo Station at which limited express trains stop (or they use Tambabashi Station, which connects to the Kintetsu Kyoto Line).
sen.cmt: Tambabashiとしました。 準急をsub-expressとしました。

sen.j: 当駅には、バス路線は乗り入れていない。
sen.e: No bus routes operate out of this station.

No bus routes operate out of this station.

sen.j: 最寄バス停は、京都市営バスの東福寺、東福寺道である。
sen.e: The nearest bus stop are both Kyoto City Bus stops, Tofukuji and Tofukuji-michi.
The nearest bus stops are Kyoto City Bus stops: Tofukuji and Tofukuji-michi.
The nearest bus stops are Kyoto City Bus stops: Tofukuji and Tofukuji-michi.

sen.e: Located along Higashi-oji-dori, some 5min. on foot from the station.

sen.e: Route Minami 5: For Takeda Station (Kyoto Prefecture) Higashi-guchi (via Fushimi-Inari Taisha)/For Kyoto Station
Route Minami 5: For Takeda Station (Kyoto Prefecture) Higashi-guchi (via Fushimi-Inari Taisha)/for Kyoto Station
Route Minami (south) 5: For Takeda Station (Kyoto Prefecture) Higashi-guchi (East Exit) (via Fushimi Inari Taisha Shrine)/for Kyoto Station

sen.j: 現在の奈良線京都・稲荷間は東海道本線の一部として1879年（明治12年）に開業したが、当時は東福寺駅は設けられていなかった。
sen.e: Tofukuji Station did not exist when the distance between Kyoto and Inari of Nara was inaugurated as a part of the present Tokaido Main Line in 1879.
Tofukuji Station did not exist when the distance between Kyoto and Inari of Nara was inaugurated as a part of the present Tokaido Main Line in 1879.
Tofukuji Station didn't exist when the distance between Kyoto and Inari of Nara Line was inaugurated as part of the present Tokaido Main Line in 1879.

sen.j: 1910年（明治43年）4月15日 京阪電気鉄道の東福寺駅が開業。
sen.e: Keihan Electric Railway Tofukuji Station inaugurated on April 15, 1910.
Keihan Electric Railway Tofukuji Station inaugurated on April 15, 1910.
April 15, 1910: Keihan Electric Railway Tofukuji Station was inaugurated.

sen.j: 1943年（昭和18年）10月1日 会社合併により京阪神急行電鉄の駅となる。
sen.e: Became a Keihanshin-kyuko-dentetsu Station on Oct. 1, 1943 as a result of amalgamation.
It became a Keihanshin-kyuko-dentetsu Station on Oct. 1, 1943 as a result of amalgamation.
October 1, 1943: The station became a Keihanshin-kyuko-dentetsu station as a result of amalgamation.

sen.j: 1949年（昭和24年）12月1日 会社分離により京阪電気鉄道の駅となる。
sen.e: Became a Keihan Electric Railway station on Dec. 1, 1949 from corporate severance.
It became a Keihan Electric Railway station on Dec. 1, 1949 due to the corporate severance.
December 1, 1949: The station became a Keihan Electric Railway station due to the corporate severance.

sen.j: 1957年（昭和32年）12月27日 日本国有鉄道奈良線の東福寺駅が開業。
sen.e: Japanese National Railways Nara Line Tofukuji Station inaugurated on Dec. 27, 1957.
Japanese National Railways' Tofukuji Station on the Nara Line was inaugurated on Dec. 27, 1957.
December 27, 1957: Japan National Railways' Tofukuji Station on the Nara Line was inaugurated.

sen.j: 当時は国鉄の駅務は京阪に委託されており、国鉄の乗車券も京阪の窓口で販売されていた。
sen.e: Operations of the Japan National Railways station at the time were commissioned to Keihan and JNR tickets were also sold at Keihan windows.
The operations of the Japan National Railways station at the time were commissioned to Keihan, but JNR tickets were also sold at the Keihan windows.
The operations of the Japan National Railways station at the time were commissioned to Keihan, and JNR tickets were also sold at the Keihan windows.

sen.j: 1987年（昭和62年）4月1日 国鉄分割民営化により、奈良線の駅がJR西日本の駅となる。
sen.e: Nara Line stations became JR-West stations on April 1, 1987 as a result of split privatization of Japan National Railways.
The Nara Line stations became JR-West stations on April 1, 1987 as a result of the split privatization of Japan National Railways.
April 1, 1987: The Nara Line stations became JR West stations as a result of the split privatization of Japan National Railways.

sen.j: 1993年（平成5年）5月19日 京阪東福寺駅大阪行きホーム屋根延伸61m→100m、車イス用トイレ設置。
sen.e: Roofs over the platform for Osaka at Keihan Tofukuji Station extended from 61m. to 100m. on May 9, 1993 and a restroom which can be used by those on wheelchairs installed.
The roof over the platform for Osaka at Keihan Tofukuji Station was extended from 61 meters to 100 meters on May 9, 1993, and a wheelchair-accessible restroom was installed.
May 9, 1993: The roof over the platform for Osaka at Keihan Tofukuji Station was extended from 61 meters to 100 meters, and a wheelchair-accessible restroom was installed.

sen.j: 1993年（平成5年）10月23日駅務室建て替え工事竣工。
sen.e: Construction of new station administrative offices completed on Oct. 23, 1993.
The construction of new station administrative offices was completed on Oct. 23, 1993.
October 23, 1993: The construction of new station administrative offices was completed.

sen.j: 1993年（平成5年）12月5日 JR奈良線東福寺駅が橋上駅舎化。
sen.e: Construction of JR Nara Line Tofukuji Station administrative offices over tracks completed on Dec. 5, 1993.
The construction of JR Nara Line Tofukuji Station administrative offices over the tracks was completed on Dec. 5, 1993.
December. 5, 1993: The construction of JR Nara Line Tofukuji Station administrative offices over the tracks was completed.

sen.j: これにより、それまで全面的に京阪に委託されていたJRの駅務が分離され(乗換改札口が橋上駅舎内に設置された)、京阪の上りホームと仕切なしでつながっていた奈良線ホーム（現在の2番のりば）との間に壁が設置された。
sen.e: From such change, JR station affairs which were totally commissioned to Keihan until then (transfer wickets installed within over-track facilities) and Keihan inbound platform which was connected to Nara Line platform (present Track #2 platform) without a partition was partitioned off.

Given such a change, the JR station affairs, which had been totally commissioned to Keihan until then (transfer wickets installed within the over-track facilities) and Keihan inbound platform, which was connected to Nara Line platform (currently the track No. 2 platform) without a partition, were partitioned off.

Given such a change, the JR station affairs, which had been totally commissioned to Keihan until then (transfer wickets installed within the over-track facilities) and Keihan inbound platform, which was connected to Nara Line platform (currently Platform 2) without a partition, were partitioned off.

sen.j: また、それまで京阪の上りホームで営業していた売店が閉店し、代わりに自動販売機が置かれた。
sen.e: Kiosk stall which used to operate on Keihan inbound platform until then closed and automatic vending machines installed in its place.
A kiosk stall that had operated on the Keihan inbound platform was closed, and automatic vending machines were installed in its place.
A kiosk stall that had operated on the Keihan inbound platform was closed, and automatic vending machines were installed in its place.

sen.j: 1994年（平成6年）8月12日 出町柳行きホームに車イス用スロープ設置。
sen.e: Wheelchair slope installed on platform for Demachiyanagi on Aug. 12, 1994.
A wheelchair ramp was installed on the platform for Demachiyanagi on Aug. 12, 1994.
August 12, 1994: A wheelchair ramp was installed on the platform for Demachiyanagi.

sen.j: 1994年（平成6年）12月27日 京阪東福寺駅改良工事竣工、出町柳行きホーム屋根延伸・スロープの設置など。
sen.e: Keihan Tofukuji Station improvement works such as roof extension on platform for Demachiyanagi, slope installation, etc. completed on Dec. 27, 1994.
Keihan Tofukuji Station improvement works, such as the roof extension on the platform for Demachiyanagi, slope installation, etc., were completed on Dec. 27, 1994.
December 27, 1994: Keihan Tofukuji Station improvement works, such as the roof extension on the platform for Demachiyanagi, slope installation, etc., were completed.

sen.j: 2001年（平成13年）10月1日 奈良線東福寺駅が快速・区間快速停車駅となる。
sen.e: Nara Line Tofukuji Station, on Oct. 1, 2001, became a station at which rapid and regional rapid trains stop.
Nara Line Tofukuji Station, on Oct. 1, 2001, became a station at which rapid and regional rapid trains stop.
October 1, 2001: Nara Line Tofukuji Station became a station at which rapid and regional rapid trains stop.

sen.j: 2003年（平成15年）3月15日 奈良線東福寺駅が「みやこ路快速」停車駅となる。
sen.e: Nara Line Tofukuji Station, on March 15, 2003, became a station at which Miyako rapid trains stop.
Nara Line Tofukuji Station, on March 15, 2003, became a station at which Miyako rapid trains stop.
March 15, 2003: Nara Line Tofukuji Station became a stop for Miyakoji Rapid Service.

sen.j: 2003年（平成15年）9月6日 京阪本線東福寺駅が準急停車駅となる。
sen.e: Keihan Main Line Tofukuji Station, on Sept. 6, 2003, became a station at which sub-express trains stop.
Keihan Main Line Tofukuji Station, on Sept. 6, 2003, became a station at which sub-express trains stop.
September 6, 2003: Keihan Main Line Tofukuji Station became a station at which sub-express trains stop.

sen.j: 2003年（平成15年）9月13日 JRと京阪の改札が完全分離。
sen.e: JR and Keihan wickets completely separated on Sept. 13, 2003.
The JR and Keihan wickets were completely separated on Sept. 13, 2003.
September 13, 2003: The JR and Keihan wickets were completely separated.

sen.j: 京阪の改札内にJRの中間改札が存在するという形が解消された。
sen.e: The configuration of JR having an intermediate wicket within Keihan ticket gates eliminated.
The configuration in which JR had an intermediate wicket within the Keihan ticket gates was eliminated.
The configuration in which JR had an intermediate wicket within the Keihan ticket gates was eliminated.
